author: trimetilo
content: Hello! it looks like the devnet5 explorer at http://134.209.87.158:8080/ is not sync. Any idea?

author: jochembrouwer
content: I just noticed this, I assume that the `signer(tx).balance` check should also include `tx.value`?

author: ralexstokes
content: the idea is that the EIP gives things _beyond_ what the client would already do; so all of the existing checks apply and this one is called out bc you also need to incorporate the data gas as part of the fee payment

author: jochembrouwer
content:
I completely understand why you want to make this complex EIP spec to be minimized as much as possible without dumping semi-unrelated checks in there.

However, it does incorporate the `tx.gas * tx_max_fee_per_gas` as well, and the client already checked that previously, so that point would also apply to that part, right?

author: jochembrouwer
content: I don't want to start bike shedding here though, feel free to dismiss my point

author: jochembrouwer
content:
> The precompile MUST reject non-canonical field elements (i.e. provided field elements MUST be strictly less than `BLS_MODULUS`).

I have no idea what inputs are the "field elements" as a crypto novice. Which inputs should I check against `BLS_MODULUS`?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<asn_d6> > <asn_d6>  replying to: 
 ```@testing4844_bot wrote: 
 <Jochem Brouwer (jochem-brouwer)> > The precompile MUST reject non-canonical field elements (i.e. provided field elements MUST be strictly less than `BLS_MODULU...```
 this is done by the precompile itself

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> u just pass bytes to it and it does the verification internally

author: jochembrouwer

content: give me a second I'll fill them out and post the file here

author: jochembrouwer
content:
Hi Mario, for all tests which fail on our side we get `Error: versioned hash does not start with KZG commitment version`

I checked, and if I run this: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/v0.2.5 then there are 3 tests which produce this error as well (but in those tests, this error should indeed be raised). 

On this fixture you sent, these data hashes indeed do not start with 1. Did something change in the spec or in the test format? (Maybe we are loading them wrong as well)

author: marioevz
content:
You're right, it's missing this PR üòì 
https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/126
